metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17479 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In OpenJPEG 2.3.0, a stack-based buffer overflow was discovered in the pgxtoimage function in jpwl/convert.c. The vulnerability causes an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possibly remote code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17479` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjpeg-java - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
libopenjpeg5 - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpeg-tools - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-dec-server - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-server - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-viewer - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
openjpip-viewer-xerces - 1:1.5.2-3.1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u3build0.16.04.1
No subscription required
